title: Taskboard
subtitle: A Kanban for Human-AI collaboration
description: TaskBoardAI is a lightweight, file-based kanban board system designed for AI agents and human-in-the-loop collaboration. It bridges the gap between AI assistants and human project management, allowing both to maintain and manipulate shared project boards with synchronized updates.
bullets: MCP Server integration for AI assistant compatibility
JSON-based architecture for easy AI parsing
Rich markdown with subtasks and dependencies
Real-time collaboration with webhooks

props.title: TaskBoardAI: Designing for Human-AI Collaboration
props.description: TaskBoardAI was born out of a frustration using markdown to-do lists becoming challenging to maintain. I wanted a way for both AI agents and humans to manage the same tasks effectively. This lightweight kanban demonstrates how thoughtful UX design can create seamless collaboration by giving people and AI an interface that works best for them while sharing the same underlying data.
bulletPoints: A lightweight kanban board built to solve real workflow challenges
Utilizes a dual interface design. Visual for people and structured data for AI agents

slides.alt: Introduction to TaskBoardAI project and human-AI collaboration approach

items.label: Dual Interface. One Solution.
items.content: The core insight: AI agents and humans have fundamentally different interaction preferencesâ€”humans prefer visual drag-and-drop experiences while AI agents work best with structured file operations.
items.imageAlt: Frustrated developer looking at complex markdown files

items.label: For People
items.content: Visual drag-and-drop kanban interface with real-time updates. Cards move smoothly between columns with markdown support for rich task descriptions, subtasks, tags, and dependencies
items.imageAlt: Split screen showing JSON data and kanban board UI

items.label: For AI Agents
items.content: Direct access to JSON structure through file operations. Model Context Protocol (MCP) integration provides automatic context. Card-first architecture enables single-attribute updates for efficient task reorganization.
items.imageAlt: Human and AI working together on the same kanban board

slides.alt: Problem identification and solution approach with interactive exploration

title: tkr-context-kit
subtitle: Agent Experience (AGx) Design for AI Collaboration
description: A comprehensive toolkit pioneering Agent Experience (AGx) Design - treating AI agents as primary users with their own needs, preferences, and interaction patterns. Features semantic YAML architectures, service-oriented design, and persistent context systems for enhanced human-AI collaboration.
bullets: Agent Experience (AGx) design methodology with AI as primary user
70% token reduction through semantic anchor YAML architecture
11 specialized AI agents for context-aware development
Service-oriented architecture with React dashboard and knowledge graph
MCP integration for persistent AI memory across conversations

props.title: tkr-context-kit: Pioneering Agent Experience (AGx) Design
props.description:
tkr-context-kit represents pioneering work in Agent Experience (AGx) Design - essentially UX design for AI agents. By conducting user research with AI agents themselves and designing information architecture for their consumption patterns, this project demonstrates how we can create systems that optimize human-AI collaboration.

The breakthrough insight was treating AI agents as primary users with their own needs, preferences, and cognitive patterns. This led to designing semantic architectures, progressive context disclosure, and conversational memory systems that make every interaction more effective.
bulletPoints: Agent Experience (AGx) design with AI agents as primary users
User research conducted directly with AI agents for iterative feedback
Semantic anchor YAML system reducing token count by 70% while maintaining information density
Service-oriented architecture enabling modular AI collaboration tools
Conversational systems design for persistent context and memory across interactions

slides.alt: Introduction to tkr-context-kit and Agent Experience design approach

items.label: AGx Concept
items.content: Agent Experience (AGx) Design treats AI agents as primary users with their own needs, preferences, and cognitive patterns. Just as UX design optimizes for human interaction patterns, AGx design creates information architectures and interfaces specifically tailored for how AI agents process, understand, and interact with systems.
items.imageAlt: AI agent interacting with optimized data structures

items.label: AI User Research
items.content: We conducted user research directly with AI agents, iterating on YAML architectures based on their feedback about information density, semantic clarity, and processing efficiency. This human-AI collaborative design process revealed insights about how agents consume context differently than humans.
items.imageAlt: Collaborative design session between human and AI

items.label: System Impact
items.content: The result is a 70% reduction in token usage while maintaining information density, persistent context that eliminates repetitive explanations, and conversational systems that make every human-AI interaction more effective and productive.

slides.alt: Agent Experience design philosophy and approach
Interactive demonstration of parallel agent execution analyzing tkr-portfolio
Interactive YAML context system with token efficiency comparison
Visualization of context persistence across conversation turns
Real metrics from analyzing tkr-portfolio with parallel agents

title: Nutrien
subtitle: Safety Portal
description: Nutrien, the world's largest provider of crop inputs and services, needed a solution to streamline safety document management across 1300 branch locations. The Operating Standards feature simplifies how staff download required global documents and upload completed forms while maintaining compliance.
bullets: Designed an intuitive interface connecting global standards with local branch files
Created responsive components that maintain consistent sizing across all devices
Used user testing insights to identify and address critical compliance concerns
Improved document organization to prevent errors in safety audits

slides.alt: Nutrien Safety Portal multi-file uploader showcase

title: Worldplay
subtitle: Analytics Dashboard â€” Discovery Process

bullets: Real-time analytics visualization
Custom report builder
Audience segmentation tools

title: Context-Kit v2
subtitle: AI-Powered Development Toolkit

bullets: AGx Design methodology for AI-human workflow optimization
Multi-service TypeScript architecture with workspace coordination
Comprehensive logging ecosystem across browser, Node.js, and terminal
SQLite knowledge graph with FTS5 full-text search capabilities
YAML optimization reducing configuration complexity by 70%

title: TaskBoardAI v2
subtitle: Dual Interface AI Collaboration
description: TaskBoardAI v2 revolutionizes project management through dual-interface design, enabling seamless collaboration between human visual workflows and AI agent task manipulation. A breakthrough in human-AI interface design for project coordination.
bullets: Dual-interface design optimized for both human and AI interaction patterns
Real-time synchronization between Kanban visual interface and JSON API
MCP Server integration enabling AI agents to read and manipulate project boards
File-based architecture ensuring data portability and AI accessibility
Validated through extensive user testing with markdown list frustrated users

props.title: The Frustrated Markdown User
props.subtitle: Primary Research Insights

persona.name: Sarah Chen
persona.quote: I love markdown for documentation, but tracking project progress in text lists feels like swimming upstream.

demographics.tools: GitHub, Notion, Linear, various markdown editors

painPoints.description: Converting markdown task lists to visual boards is manual and time-consuming
Team members prefer visual kanban while she thinks in structured text
AI agents can read markdown but can't interact with visual project boards

goals: Maintain markdown workflow for planning and documentation
Provide team with visual kanban interface for collaboration
Enable AI agents to participate in project management

research.key_finding: Users want format flexibility without workflow disruption

slides.alt: User persona representing frustrated markdown users needing visual collaboration

title: AI Progress Steps v2
subtitle: 5-Stage AI Collaboration Journey
description: AI Progress Steps v2 maps the evolutionary journey of AI-human collaboration proficiency through five distinct stages. This framework helps individuals and teams understand their current capabilities and provides clear pathways for advancement in AI-powered workflows.
bullets: Comprehensive 5-stage framework mapping AI collaboration evolution
Skills assessment matrix with clear progression indicators
Emotional journey mapping showing confidence and capability growth
Prompt evolution tracking from basic requests to complex workflows
Creator-level persona representing advanced AI collaboration mastery

stages.name: Chatter
stages.description: Basic conversation with AI, like casual chat - scattered thoughts and simple questions

stages.name: Prompter
stages.description: Role: Dev Lead. Goal: Act as a Sr Python Developer. Pair programming with a junior.

stages.name: Collaborator
stages.description: Name: Librarian. Role: Retrieve and save text from a given web page. Tools: web-scraper, write-to-system

stages.name: Coordinator
stages.description: @Librarian get the latest documentation from www.example.com @DevLead Review the updated docs and audit current codebase to identify any required changes

stages.name: Creator
stages.description: Goal: A SaaS application with full technical specs, project/specs, design files in /project/design, and three parallel agents to review docs and codebase
insights: Create complex software by orchestrating bots and agents

slides.alt: Five-stage AI collaboration journey from chatter to creator

props.title: Emotional Journey Mapping
props.subtitle: Confidence and Capability Growth Through AI Collaboration Stages

flowSteps.label: Chatter
flowSteps.description: Casual exploration phase with scattered thoughts and simple requests. No clear strategy or direction in AI interactions.
userActions: Treating AI like a search engine

flowSteps.label: Prompter
flowSteps.description: Learning structured prompt techniques using Role.Goal.Tasks framework for consistent, repeatable interactions.

flowSteps.label: Collaborator
flowSteps.description: Building specialized AI team members with named personas and tool integration beyond basic chat.
thoughts: AI as a specialized team member

flowSteps.label: Coordinator
flowSteps.description: Orchestrating multiple AI agents with @mentions for parallel execution and complex task decomposition.

flowSteps.label: Creator
flowSteps.description: Building AI-enhanced products and novel collaboration patterns while teaching methodologies to others.

insights: Confidence grows exponentially as structure and frameworks are learned
Tool integration transforms AI from chat assistant to specialized team member
Multi-agent coordination requires system-level thinking and architecture skills
Creator level involves building novel AI experiences and teaching methodologies

slides.alt: Emotional journey mapping showing confidence and capability growth across AI collaboration stages

props.title: Prompt Evolution Across Stages
props.subtitle: How Communication with AI Agents Develops Over Time

conversationStages.context: Casual, no clear direction or structure
conversationStages.aiResponse: I'd love to help! Could you tell me what kind of app you're thinking about? What problem should it solve?
conversationStages.learningPoint: Scattered thoughts need focus to be actionable

conversationStages.prompt:
Role: Dev Lead
Goal: Act as a Senior Python Developer
Tasks: Help me with pair programming for a web scraper that extracts product data
conversationStages.aiResponse: As a Senior Python Developer, I'll help you build a robust web scraper. Let's start by identifying the target website and discussing the data structure...
conversationStages.outcome: Clear, actionable guidance with technical depth
conversationStages.learningPoint: Structure dramatically improves AI response quality

conversationStages.prompt:
Name: Librarian
Role: Retrieve and save text from a given web page
Tools: web-scraper, write-to-system

Librarian, please extract all documentation from https://docs.example.com and save it to our knowledge base.
conversationStages.context: Named AI persona with specific tools and capabilities
conversationStages.aiResponse: [Systematic extraction of documentation with proper formatting, error handling, and knowledge base integration]
conversationStages.outcome: Autonomous task completion with tool integration
conversationStages.learningPoint: Named personas with tools enable specialized workflows

conversationStages.context: Multi-agent coordination with @mentions and parallel tasks
conversationStages.aiResponse: [Coordinated response from multiple specialized agents working in parallel, with cross-references and integrated deliverables]
conversationStages.learningPoint: Agent coordination enables system-level problem solving

conversationStages.prompt: Goal: Create a comprehensive SaaS application with full technical specifications, project documentation in /project/specs, design files in /project/design, and orchestrate three parallel agents: @Architect for system design, @Developer for implementation, @Designer for UI/UX. Each agent should have context beyond the current repo and coordinate their outputs for a production-ready portfolio system.
conversationStages.context: Multi-layered system creation with agent orchestration
conversationStages.aiResponse: [Sophisticated coordination of multiple specialized agents creating interconnected deliverables, with automatic context management and production-ready outputs]
conversationStages.outcome: Complete system architecture with coordinated implementation
conversationStages.learningPoint: AI becomes a strategic thinking partner

evolutionPatterns: Prompts evolve from vague to highly specific
Role definition and constraints emerge in advanced stages
Multi-turn and complex request handling develops
Strategic thinking integration appears at creator level

slides.alt: Agent conversation flow showing prompt evolution from basic to sophisticated across five stages
